column4: How might I update a package (Freepascal, currently 2.2.0 in the manager) to a newer version? installing from a .deb file does not work, the package stays the same.
what version do you want to install?
2.2.2, from 2.2.0. It is impossible for me to update from the projects SVN, 2.2.0 is too old to compile the newer version ;)
the compiler is written in freepascal?
Yes, it happens to be.
and needs the latest version to compile the latest version?.. great thinking there
:S
I didn't develop it.
well.. you need to find precompiled binaries then.. ubuntu doesn't supply those for the version you want.. so I guess you need to go pester the fp developers
do you have an url to the bug report?
No... apparently, no one experiencing the problem has made one.
well.. then I think it's safe to say that no.. it hasn't been fixed =/
does this look like your problem? https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gdm/+bug/546587
although it just affects the keyboard
No, it affects my mouse as well... My mouse is USB, however, that might be part of it.
Sounds like it, but is 10.04 karmic...?
nope.. but lucid is mentioned further down.. there's also this bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gdm/+bug/577173
this might also be useful http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=9294246

Thanks. The first one looks like it's the one I'm talking about... If I can upgrade the kernel, it should work, apparently. How might I do that via SSH? Or, rather, how might I do that via command line?
if the new kernel is available from the repos you just run "sudo apt-get update" and then "sudo apt-get dist-upgrade"
That I did. It might be recent, I will try again. Thanks :)
